newsitem.title: FRANCE: Schneider sells MGE unit stake.
newsitem.headline: Schneider sells MGE unit stake.

text.p: Schneider SA said on Monday it sold 71 percent of its 100-percent owned MGE UPS Systems thyratron inverter manufacturer to Euro Capital Partners.
The company did not give the price for the sale.
Schneider will retain control over 29 percent of MGE UPS capital, Schneider said.
A thyratron inverter is a device which prevents the interruption in the supply of electricity to protect electronic equipment.
MGE UPS Systems had 1995 turnover of two billion francs and employs 1,800 people, Schneider said.
After the deal, MGE UPS Systems will be 71-percent owned by Euro Capital and other investors, 15-percent owned by MGS UPS employees and 14-percent owned by Schneider Electric.
